stem: Which factor most determines functional residual capacity (FRC) in a normal adult?
explanation: FRC is set by the balance between inward lung recoil and outward chest wall recoil; lung recoil is dominant.

stem: Which feature best distinguishes apoptosis from necrosis?
explanation: Apoptosis produces internucleosomal DNA fragmentation with minimal inflammation.

A spiral fracture of the humeral shaft most commonly injures which structure?
explanation: The radial nerve runs in the spiral groove along the humeral shaft.

stem: A 26-year-old with life-threatening asthma arrives with pH 7.10, PaCO2 120, lactate 4. Outline immediate priorities and initial management in ED.
model_answer: Recognise life-threatening asthma with hypercapnic respiratory failure. Priorities: high-flow O2 titrated to SpO2 94–98%; nebulised salbutamol and ipratropium; IV steroids; consider IV magnesium; prepare for NIV vs intubation with ketamine if peri-arrest; early senior help; escalate to ICU; address triggers and safety-net.

stem: 50-year-old with severe midface fractures, GCS 4, SpO2 90% on NRBM. Outline your airway plan, including rescue strategies.
model_answer: Anticipate blood/secretions and distorted anatomy; call for help; set up RSI with bougie/video laryngoscopy; optimise positioning and suction; maximum three attempts with changes; if failure and cannot oxygenate, proceed to front-of-neck access (scalpel-bougie-tube); confirm ETCO2; lung-protective ventilation; imaging and definitive surgical planning.
